attributes.action: conduct a review into the operations of the english football association
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
as an england fan and an aston villa supporter i find it difficult to watch the english game deteriate into an edition of heat magazine.

the english fa have made many poor decisions for example the national stadium at wembley, the national youth training academy, the hiring and firing of coaches and the biased disciplinary punishments given to club teams and players.

an independent regulatory body needs to be set up in order to hold the power brokers in the fa to account and provide an outlet for grass roots supporters to voice concerns.

rejection.details: The Government does not have a role in the sporting and commercial operation of professional football. In common with all sports, it is for the football authorities to regulate their own internal affairs. You can write to the Football Association with your views at 25 Soho Square, London W1D 4FA or at www.TheFA.com/feedback.
reasons: Outside the remit of the Prime Minister and Government
